definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Hello, long time no see. How are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 你好，好久不见。你怎么样？

sentences.english: Ann, long time no see. Where were you going?
sentences.chinese: 安，好久不见，你去了哪里？

sentences.english: Maybe you have a boyfriend or girlfriend that you haven't seen in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 也许你已经好久不见你的男朋友或者女朋友了。

sentences.english: It's been a long time, Mrs. Lee.
And you know, sometimes you run into people that you haven't seen in a while, so it's nice.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，有时候你碰上一些好久不见的人，这很好。

sentences.english: He smiled, and circled around the group. “Long time no see.
sentences.chinese: 他微笑着说，搂住了她们两个，“好久不见。

sentences.english: Yang Guang, long time no see. What on earth have you been doing these days?
sentences.chinese: 杨光，好久不见。这些天你究竟在做什么？

sentences.english: Laotian, long time no see. Where are you going?
sentences.chinese: 老田，好久不见你了，你到哪里去了？

sentences.english: The second section, disappears for a long time the old schoolmate, crosses fortunately?
sentences.chinese: 第二段，好久不见了老同学，过的还好吗？

definition: (literary) I trust you have been well since we last met

pinyin: ren2 sheng1 he2 chu4 bu4 xiang1 feng2

definition: old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
to see each other/to meet in person
